subject: Parenting
title: Why Babies Cry
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Babies Cry.

hook.text: A newborn screams for hours. You've fed, changed, and rocked her. Nothing works.

buildup.text: Crying is a baby's only language â€” it signals hunger, pain, or overstimulation.

discovery.text: Researchers found distinct cry patterns: short bursts for hunger, high-pitched for pain.

twist.text: Sometimes there's no clear cause. The nervous system is simply overwhelmed and resetting.

climax.text: Babies whose cries get responses actually cry less over time, not more.

quiz.question: What happens when a baby's cries are consistently responded to?
options: They cry more to get attention
